speaker: User
message: good afternoon! may I ask: if we take a sentence from e.g. our introduction (which was taken from a source) and repeat it in our executive summary, must we cite it twice?

speaker: User
message: to clarify, i mean citation as in-text citation

speaker: User
message: to confirm, i cite it again in the introduction right?

speaker: Help Desk
message: Hi PERSON_FIRSTNAME_1, good day to you. Thank you for contacting SMU Libraries. My name is PERSON_FIRSTNAME_3. How may I help you today?

speaker: Help Desk
message: Thank you for your query. Please hold while I check.

speaker: Help Desk
message: Is your executive summary at the beginning of your paper or end?

speaker: Help Desk
message: Please take a look at this:

speaker: Help Desk
message: In that case, if it is not your idea or if you are paraphrasing someone else's, then the in-text citation would be necessary.

speaker: Help Desk
message: Yes, since you are mentioning it and it is not your ideas.
